climbs.name: Whiskey River
climbs.fa: C. Busch and J. Johnson, early 2000s

content.description: Once again, I have not climbed this one and will get more from the FA party and update. This starts up a left-facing corner with many large, stacked blocks at the start. I will try to lock down the grade soon, otherwise it may be easier or harder than 9+.
content.protection: Do a double rope rappel off of hangers with webbing and rings. The webbing probably will need replacement. The anchor is left of the crack system.
content.location:
This is 60-80 feet to the right of "

People are Watching

."

climbs.name: Unknown Crack aka People are Watching

content.description: Climb up a crack that quickly widens into a pod that takes a #5 c4 then though a small roof that pulls thin hands and continues to cupped hands to the anchor right of the crack.  The wide pod has some great rib-like features that are helpful.  I thought the short but enjoyable crux was at the thin hands exit from the pod.
content.protection: Cams finger to #3.5 Friends ought to work and 1 #5 c4. Bring double #3 c4s too.  Slings may need replacing on the fixed pins right of the crack.
content.location:
It is 60-80' right of "

Make John Do It

."

climbs.name: Make John Do It
climbs.fa: C. Busch and J. Johnson, early 2000s

content.description: I am not sure what to say for the rating, since I have not climbed this one. It was done as two pitches originally, but it looks as if it could be done in one long pitch  The crack looks wide, blocky, and very protectable. If done in two pitches, you will need a gear belay for the first pitch. This probably never had a second ascent, and most likely it is dirty. Treat it as an adventure! I am not trying to sandbag the route, and it may be easier that the given grade. I will talk to the FA and see what they remember and update.
content.protection: The crack looks mostly wide but fairly variable. Bring a rack as if it was a FA minus the bolt kit. Metolius rappel anchors are about forty feet short of the top of the cliff left of the crack. Do one double rope rappel.
content.location:
This is 10-20 feet to the right of

Caroline's Crack

, up a right-facing corner of sorts.

content.description: This climb follows the obvious offwidth located on the far left side of the Box Elder Buttress. Begin with blocky hand cracks, and climb them for 20 feet before heading climber's right to enter the offwidth. The offwidth is sweet and has many features around it to make it just 5.7. This a great entry level offwidth, and it protects well too.
content.protection:
This mostly protects with hand-size cams, and you'll need two larger cams (#5 or #6 Camalot) for the offwidth section. You can protect the top of the off width with a 2" piece (either a #2 Friend of #1 Camalot).

There is a two bolt chained anchor up top.
content.location:
This route is locked to the far looker's left of the Box Elder Campground and 10 feet left of

Caroline's Crack

.

content.protection: Hand-size cams and a two bolt chain anchor up top.
content.location: This route is located directly across the river from the Box Elder Campsite. It's on the far looker's left of the buttress or "Whiskey Wall".
